greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) is the second smallest prime factor of n, or 1 if n is a prime power.
comment: Least prime factor of {n divided by the maximal power of the least prime factor of n}. - after the original name of the sequence.
a(n) = 1 iff n is a prime power: a(A000961(n))=1 and a(A024619(n))>1.
link: Antti Karttunen, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
results.author: _Reinhard Zumkeller_, May 13 2006
